alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:05AM CDT until August 04 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN MORGAN COUNTY... At 505 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across northwest Alabama. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Decatur and Trinity. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
